dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/1492590760 at Tue Aug 10 16:01:12 UTC 2021

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: frontend Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="frontend"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="frontend"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="frontend"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="frontend"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="frontend"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="frontend"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="frontend"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="frontend"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

panels.title: frontend Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="frontend"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="frontend"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="frontend"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="frontend"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="frontend"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="frontend"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",type="frontend"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="frontend"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better
panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write IOPs

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Throughput

panels.description: Total time spent in read operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Total Time

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.description: CPU scheduling waiting on the run queue, as a percentage of time. Aggregated to worst CPU per node. Lower is better.
panels.title: CPU Scheduling Waiting

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"})
/
count by (environment, type, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Disk inode utilization per device per node.

If this is too high, its possible that a directory is filling up with
files. Consider logging in an checking temp directories for large numbers
of files
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - (
        node_filesystem_files_free{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}
        /
        node_filesystem_files{fstype=~"(ext.|xfs)", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_inodes component saturation: Disk inode Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Disk space utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", fqdn!="", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Space Utilization per Device per Node

panels.description:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{fqdn!="", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.description:
Netfilter connection tracking table utilization per node.

When saturated, new connection attempts (incoming SYN packets) are dropped with no reply, leaving clients to slowly retry (and typically fail again) over the next several seconds.  When packets are being dropped due to this condition, kernel will log the event as: "nf_conntrack: table full, dropping packet".
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      max_over_time(node_nf_conntrack_entries{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}[1m])
      /
      node_nf_conntrack_entries_limit{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: nf_conntrack_entries component saturation: conntrack Entries per Node

panels.description:
Measures the amount of scheduler waiting time that processes are waiting
to be scheduled, according to [`CPU Scheduling Metrics`](https://www.robustperception.io/cpu-scheduling-metrics-from-the-node-exporter).

A high value indicates that a node has more processes to be run than CPU time available
to handle them, and may lead to degraded responsiveness and performance from the application.

Additionally, it may indicate that the fleet is under-provisioned.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without (cpu) (rate(node_schedstat_waiting_seconds_total{env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}[1h]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: node_schedstat_waiting component saturation: Node Scheduler Waiting Time

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance

panels.description:
This resource measures average CPU utilization across an all cores in a shard of a
service fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the
shard needs horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: shard_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Shard

panels.description:
Average CPU utilization per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{fqdn!="", mode="idle", env="$environment",environment="$environment",stage="$stage",type="frontend"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Utilization per Node

panels.description: Seconds of CPU time for the named process group, per second
panels.title: Process CPU Time
